title: Calories in a Poke Bowl
meta_description: Discover calories in poke bowl, including full nutrition breakdown with protein, carbs, fat, and tips for variations under 600 kcal.
assumptions: Standard serving: 1 cup sushi rice, 4 oz raw ahi tuna, cucumber, edamame, avocado (1/4), seaweed, sesame seeds, soy-based dressing; no extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by restaurant, portion size, fish type, rice, toppings, and dressing; homemade versions differ. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard poke bowl has about 600 kcal, with 30 g protein from tuna and 70 g carbs from rice.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant info.

tweaks.label: Use cauliflower rice instead of sushi rice

faqs.q: How many calories in a poke bowl?
faqs.a: Typically 500-700 kcal for a standard serving, around 600 kcal here.

faqs.q: Is a poke bowl high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 30 g protein from fish like tuna or salmon in a standard poke bowl.

faqs.q: What makes poke bowls high in sodium?
faqs.a: Soy sauce or ponzu dressing; one bowl can have 800-1200 mg sodium.
Swap rice for greens or cauliflower rice to cut carbs from 70 g to under 20 g.

faqs.q: How do vegetarian poke bowls compare in calories?
faqs.a: Similar at 500-600 kcal, but protein drops to 15-20 g without fish; add tofu for boost.
